transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And then Grimlock the Toymaker came charging over the hill, with his evil hoard of Baby Drink 'n Wets.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So I look at him, and I say, "You don't wanna mess with me, Grimlock! I'll use my heat ray!"

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: "I'll use my heat ray"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, "I'll use my heat ray".

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (snickers)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (snickers)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What? What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You could've used a better line.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really! Like what?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, well, something like, uh, "Don't toy with me, Toymaker!"

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. Or, "These babies need changing!" And then kick his butt!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, you mean something like, "It's time to pick up your toys, Toymaker. Your room is a mess! I mean, look at it."

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What kind of line is that?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You wanna defeat him or kiss him?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wait, (laughs) here's a good one... (clears throat) "I'm going to lock you up, Grimlock!"

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Awwww, gee! (gets up and leaves)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You're pathetic! (also gets up and leaves)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wait, where are you guys going? Hey, wait! Guys! I know I'm able to do this! How about, "Watch it, Toymaker! Someone's gonna trip on those babies one day, and fall down the steps! Then you'll feel bad! (pause) Toymaker!"

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in distance) Idiot!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Hello, and how do, folks, this is Tansut, America's favorite intergalactic ne'er-do-well, welcoming you to "Space Ghost Coast to Coast". Tonight, Space Ghost yuks it up with funny man Jon Stewart. And who knows, maybe a certain green someone might get his butt blasted.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: "Butt blasted", huh? Well, take that, Tansut, (slap!) and that, (slap!) and that!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: (as Zorak hits him) Ooow! Oh! Ow, I'm sorry, I'm sorry! I... I didn't mean it that way.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Now keep reading, you're doing great! Back to the show!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings! I'm Space Ghost! Jon Stewart's here! Zorak is over there. (points in Zorak's direction) (long pause)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (off camera) Is that it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room) Jon, are you into aroma therapy? (monitor show Jon and text:)

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Well, then let me introduce you to the exotic fragrances of East India.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Sure!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever; India music plays) Jon, picture a camel, if you will, traipsing across the desert sands. (alarms go off; he throws lever again) Uh, hold on. (throws lever several times, when he does, new text appears on the monitor, flashing on and off. The decompression reading is counting down by 10's and 5's)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Jon, I accidentally unhooked your oxygen. Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Oh man... We're screwed!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Don't panic!

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: What are we gonna do?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hold your breath for ten seconds.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Oh, just... (takes a deep breath and holds it)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in the studio, as monitor lowers with Jon) My guest tonight is a fellow talk show host, a fine comedian, and a good buddy of mine. Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome Jon Stewart!

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: (still holding his breath; keels over, disappears from monitor)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Jon? Hello...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Jon, hang on. I'll revive you with my new electro-lever. (throws lever, a flash appears)

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: (sits back up) That was ten seconds?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Great galaxies, man, are you on some kind of a bender?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: (picks up microphone from floor, talks directly into it, very loud) Sorry. Sorry about that. (clips it back onto his shirt)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yyyour okay, right?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, there we go.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (My word!)

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: There, that's fixed.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (What is Hollywood doing to our children??)

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: You know, the physical gags never really work.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure they do! (blasts Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, that's true. Aaaa, okay.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (crisped) That didn't hurt.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Thank you for being on our little show, citizen Jon!

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Thank you, thank you for having me. I'm, I'm very excited to be here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're a fellow talk show host, do you have any advice for me?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Always introduce yourself to the guests before the show. That way, you know, they'll know who's hostin' it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm hosting it! Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Well, I was thinkin' you'd come into my dressing room and introduce yourself.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: But then I realized, we're on different planets, and it's really hard...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I... my sister called.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: But I was tryin' to do that, you walk up.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: And if you have Claudia Schiffert on, don't mention the word "cheese", because she freaks.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wow, that's good! Moltar, make a note of that!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I'm busy!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) We'll make a note of it. Jon, do you have problems with side kicks?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really? How come?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Can't afford one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (chuckling) Just capture one! Right, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Side kicks are good at kicking.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: May I kick you, Jon?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Are you serious?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, settle down!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'll kick your kidneys out, and then make a pie with 'em.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Serve it to ya while you're still alive!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're not makin' a pie, and that's that!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) That's what I'll do.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where were we? ... Sidekicks! What do you think they should do on a show?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: The sidekick is there to, seriously, to pipe down and not say anything.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I like that! Moltar, make a note of that!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws levers constantly) Uh, (makes "static" sound effect with his voice) I can't hear you, I ("static") breakin' up ("static")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Quit it, you're doing that with your mouth.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: What, what's that? ("static") Can't hear you. ("static") (the following messages flash across the top of his screen:)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay, we're clear for two. Anybody need anything? (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'd like some water, please.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) That was some funny stuff. Loved the kidney thing.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well, I wasn't kiddin' about that.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well, that Zorak, he's, he's pretty funny when he gets all worked up.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Just keep on keepin' on, you're doin' a great job. Love the work.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Who asked you?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Minute twenty. You need anything, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do I have time for a hot pastrami?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Minute ten. I kinda doubt it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: See what you can do.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Do you like a good pastrami sandwich?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, boy, man, do I.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Minute to go.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: What do you have on it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, just a little mayon-, I mean, mustard.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: You almost said mayonnaise, Space Ghost...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Forty-five seconds.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: ... you almost said mayonnaise on pastrami, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No I didn't, I said mustard.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: (shakes his head) Oh, Space Ghost...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I said mustard.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Thirty seconds.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry, I missed that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, mustard is what I said.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Really?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Twenty seconds.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're calling me a liar, aren't you, Stewart?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Maybe.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back silently)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Fifteen.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back silently)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ten seconds. Get ready.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back silently)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Five. Four. Three. Two.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (yells) Am I gonna get that sandwich or no-

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We're back with close personal friend and talk show compadre Jon Stewart!

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: I wanted to, you know, like I feel stupid about this...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmm hmm.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: ... just get some advice on, like, you know, talk shows and stuff. I mean, you're the man.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wait a minute! Now you want advice from me?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Absolutely, I'm lookin' for advice from you. Big man, leotards, musk. Sure!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hear that, Moltar? I've got musk!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You don't have musk!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I sure do! Manly space musk!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You smell like a farm! (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) You should stay in touch, Jon. We may have a vacancy in the control room very soon.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Look, I'm not desperate, I'm just, yeah, you know, I mean... you throw me a bone. You know what I'm sayin'?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: I don't eat much.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bones are cheap.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: I would just hang very quietly, I'd write for ya, I'd do whatever, sweep up.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: I just need experience.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: By cracky, I'll start you at courtesy clerk. Can you clean up the spill on aisle nine?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: I hope. There's room for advancement, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah. Head courtesy clerk, then cashier.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: It's up to you guys, use me as you wish. I'd join the band, I got like kind of a tambourine situation happenin'...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Tambourine? Feh!

transcript.speaker: Sorcerer
transcript.dialogue: (with Russian accent) Tambourine, phooey!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: When did you start talkin'?

transcript.speaker: Sorcerer
transcript.dialogue: Just this minute, big boy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh. Weird.

transcript.speaker: Sorcerer
transcript.dialogue: You need a shave!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who, me?

transcript.speaker: Sorcerer
transcript.dialogue: No, Jonny boy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Stay out of it!

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: I had a beard.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But you don't now.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: No. I'll tell you what, you want to know why talk show hosts don't have beards?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tell me!

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: 'Cause Mike Douglas won't let us.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really? And just who is this Mike Douglas?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: He's in charge of all the talk show hosts. He calls, and if you have, I had a, I had a, a facial hair...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: ... and I, I was forced to shave it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, Mike Douglas is a stickler for facial hair.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Does he write you too?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (angry) No, he doesn't!

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: You know the advice that I have for you, and this is something that Mike Douglas told me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wait, let me guess: work extra hard when your guests have hang-overs?

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Always open with a number.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: People love it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak? Eh, number? What do you think?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Yeah, okay. (starts playing piano intro, other instruments join in)

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Just come out, pow, pow! Hit 'em with something from "Kismet", "Oklahoma", they go crazy!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mike Douglas is a bona fide genius!

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Then you bring out, I don't know, Susanne Pleshette, and the whole thing takes off.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I am seeing things for the first time!

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: I'm here to help, I'm here. I'm tellin' you, if we get together, Space Ghost, we can make a big thing.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Mmm hmm.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: I have a little thing, you have a bigger thing, but together, we could take...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (with a "lounge" voice) Everything down a notch, Jon? Because I'd really like to take everything down a notch, if I may. You know, there's a lot of beautiful people here tonight. I see some beautiful people here. (points to one side) And right here. (points to other side) Hi! But you know, life as a superhero, ladies and gentlemen, can be... stressful. I've flown all over the galaxy, but I always come back to a special place. In my heart. It's a place called... home.

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (with Irish accent) This one's for me mum. (invisos to center stage, with spotlight, and begins to sing)

transcript.speaker: Jon Stewart
transcript.dialogue: Oh man... We're screwed!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: (being slapped) Oh! I'm sorry!
